data.title: Old Dominion Freight Line raises dividend by 7.7% to $0.28
data.description:
• Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL) declares $0.28/share quarterly dividend, 7.7% increase from prior dividend of $0.26.
  • Forward yield 0.61%
  • Payable March 19; for shareholders of record March 5; ex-div March 5.
  • See ODFL Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Sappi reports Q1 results
data.description:
• Sappi press release (OTCPK:SPPJY): Q1 Sales of $1.36B vs $1.27B.
  • Adjusted EBITDA $203 million.
  • Adjusted EPS 14 US cents.
  • Outlook: 
  • The Somerset Mill PM2 will be shut for a period of approximately 70 days in the second quarter. The project will adversely impact the second quarter earnings by approximately US$21 million.
  • Capital expenditure forecast for FY2025 has risen from US$500 million to approximately US$525 million.
  • Anticipate that Adjusted EBITDA for the second quarter of FY2025 will be below that of the first quarter of FY2025.

data.title: Wartsila reports FY results
data.description:
• Wartsila press release (OTCPK:WRTBF): FY Net sales increased by 7% to EUR 6,449 million.
  • Earnings per share increased to 0.85 euro.
  • The order book at the end of the period increased by 25% to EUR 8,366 million.

data.title: Swedish Orphan Biovitrum AB reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Swedish Orphan Biovitrum AB press release (OTCPK:BIOVF): Q4 Total revenue increased 9 percent, 8 percent at constant exchange rates, to SEK 7,436 M.
  • The adjusted EBITA margin was 34 percent, excluding items affecting comparability.
  • EBITA was SEK 2,572 M.
  • EBIT was SEK 1,662 M.
  • Earnings per share before dilution was SEK 4.07. 
  • Adjusted EPS before dilution was SEK 4.03. 

  • Outlook 2025

    • Revenue is anticipated to grow by a high single-digit percentage at CER
    • The adjusted EBITA margin is anticipated to be in the mid-30s percentage of revenue

data.title: KDDI Corporation reports Q3 results
data.description:
• KDDI Corporation press release (OTCPK:KDDIY): Q3 consolidated operating revenue was up 2.3% year on year, to ¥4,364.2 billion. 
  • Consolidated operating income was up 2.0% year on year, to ¥864.6 billion.

data.title: Companies start tallying the costs of Trump's tariffs
data.description:
As President Donald Trump's tariffs on Canada and Mexico loom, companies are starting to disclose how much of an impact the duties would have on supply chain costs.

Trump paused for one month the 25% tariffs he planned for Canadian and Mexican imports as the countries committed to reinforce border security. But Trump went ahead with additional 10% duties on Chinese goods.

In an earnings call on Tuesday, Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG) noted that it sources about 2% of its sales from Mexico, which includes avocados, tomatoes, limes, and peppers, and less than 0.5% of its sales from Canada and China.

"If the recently announced tariffs go into full effect, it would have an ongoing impact of about 60 basis points on our cost of sales," CFO Adam Rymer projected.

Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) CEO Scott Boatwright said only about 50% of the chain's avocado supply comes out of Mexico. The company has diversified beyond Mexico to Colombia, Peru, and the Dominican Republic.

To note, around 90% of the avocados eaten in the U.S. are from Mexico, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

Meanwhile, Barbie maker Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) said in light of the tariffs, it plans to take mitigating actions such as price hikes and making changes to its supply chain.

"Our tariff exposure in the U.S. related to China should be about 20% of global production," CFO Anthony DiSilvestro said in an earnings call. "And with respect to Mexico and Canada, we currently source less than 10% of our toys from Mexico and have no sourcing from Canada."

The world's leading spirits maker Diageo (NYSE:DEO) also warned of a potential $200M hit to its operating profit. CFO Nik Jhangiani noted that about 45% of the company's products sold in the U.S. are made in either Canada or Mexico, and the vast majority of that is tequila.

data.title: Disney beats on core metrics and guides an upbeat profit growth for 2025
data.description:
Media conglomerate Disney (NYSE:DIS) beat on top and bottom line numbers for the first quarter and provided a forecast for the full year that sat well with Wall Street analysts.

DIS shares are flat in early premarket trading on the NYSE.

For the full year, the company expects adjusted earnings per share growth in the high single-digit range and cash flow from operations of about $15B. The Bloomberg consensus estimate for adj. EPS growth is 8.1%, and cash flow is $15.09B.

The company also expects to incur $200M related to Disney Cruise Line pre-opening expenses and record a $300M equity loss due to the purchase accounting of the Star India deconsolidation in 2025.

In Q2, the company expects a modest decline in Disney+ subscribers sequentially, and expects an impact of $100M on sports operating income from college sports and an additional NFL game, and about $50M from exiting the Venu Sports joint venture.

During Q1, total Disney+ subscribers came in at 124.6M, which included 56.8M domestic users and 67.8M internationally. Total Hulu subscribers were 53.6M.

Domestic Disney+ average monthly revenue per paid subscriber increased to $7.99 from $7.70, due to higher pricing, partially offset by a higher mix of subscribers to promotional offerings. International Disney+ average monthly revenue per paid subscriber increased to $7.19 from $6.78 due to higher pricing and advertising revenue, partially offset by a higher mix of subscribers to promotional offerings.

In his initial reaction to the report, Seeking Alpha analyst and leader of the Investing Group "Cash Flow Club," Jonathan Weber, said, "Disney delivered a double beat, growing slightly faster than expected. The Disney+ subscriber number declined sequentially, and the same is expected for the current quarter. That being said, other business units performed reasonably well, and management foresees a nice HSD EPS increase for the current year."

Net income for the three months ended December 31 was $2.64B, compared to $2.15B for the same period last year.

On a per-share basis, the company earned $1.40, beating the average analyst estimate by 9 cents.

Revenue rose 5% to $24.7B and was ahead of expectations by $150M.

data.title: Melexis Nv Ieper reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Melexis Nv Ieper press release (OTCPK:MLXSF): Sales for the fourth quarter of 2024 were 197.4 million EUR, a decrease of 21%.
  • The net result was 18.3 million EUR or 0.45 EUR per share, a decrease of 63%.
  • Outlook:
  • Melexis expects sales in the first quarter of 2025 to be in the range of 190 to 200 million EUR.
  • For the first half of 2025, Melexis expects sales to be around 400 million euro, with a gross profit margin around 40% and an operating margin around 16%, all taking into account a EUR/USD exchange rate of 1.03.
  • Sales in the second half of 2025 are expected to grow significantly compared to the first half of 2025. For the full year 2025, Melexis expects CAPEX to be around 50 million EUR.
